robo-soccer.name: Robo Soccer
robo-soccer.shortDescription: An intense soccer match between autonomous robots, testing AI, strategy, and control.
robo-soccer.description: Robo Soccer is a high-speed challenge where autonomous robots compete in a soccer match using advanced programming and sensors. Participants must build and program robots to maneuver, pass, and score goals while overcoming obstacles and opponents.
rules: Each team must have a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 5 members.
Robots must comply with the size and weight regulations specified in the rulebook.
Teams will be given 5 minutes per match to compete.
Any form of external interference with the robot during the match will lead to disqualification.

ai-hackathon.name: AI Hackathon
ai-hackathon.shortDescription: Innovate with AI in a 24-hour hackathon.
ai-hackathon.description: The AI Hackathon challenges participants to develop innovative AI solutions in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Teams will leverage machine learning and data analytics to create practical applications.
rules: Teams must register with at least one team member being a student.
All code must be written during the hackathon event.
Use of pre-existing code from previous competitions is prohibited.

coding-marathon.name: Coding Marathon
coding-marathon.shortDescription: Solve algorithmic challenges in a timed event.
coding-marathon.description: The Coding Marathon puts your problem-solving skills to the test in a series of algorithmic challenges. Participants will work through puzzles and coding problems in a competitive environment.
rules: Participants must solve problems within the given time frame.
Internet access is allowed only for research purposes.
Plagiarism or copying code from others will lead to disqualification.

business-plan-contest.name: Business Plan Contest
business-plan-contest.shortDescription: Pitch your startup ideas to win big.
business-plan-contest.description: The Business Plan Contest is a platform for aspiring entrepreneurs to present their innovative business ideas. Participants will pitch their plans to a panel of judges and receive feedback along with potential funding opportunities.
rules: Each team must submit a business plan document before the event.
Presentations should not exceed 15 minutes.
Judging criteria include feasibility, innovation, and presentation skills.

cyber-security-workshop.name: Cyber Security Workshop
cyber-security-workshop.shortDescription: Learn ethical hacking and secure systems.
cyber-security-workshop.description: The Cyber Security Workshop is an immersive session on ethical hacking, network security, and safeguarding digital assets. Participants will learn hands-on techniques to secure systems and understand vulnerabilities.
rules: Participants must bring their own laptops.
Pre-requisites include basic knowledge of networking and programming.
Certification will be provided upon completion.

robotics-challenge.name: Robotics Challenge
robotics-challenge.shortDescription: Build, program, and battle in a robotics arena.
robotics-challenge.description: The Robotics Challenge invites participants to build and program robots that can compete in a series of physical and technical challenges. The competition tests engineering skills, coding prowess, and innovative design.
rules: All teams must submit their design proposal before the event.
The robot must be built within the specified size and weight constraints.
Teams will have one practice session before the competition begins.

gaming-tournament.name: Gaming Tournament
gaming-tournament.shortDescription: Compete in the latest esports challenges.
gaming-tournament.description: The Gaming Tournament is an exciting competition where gamers battle it out in popular video games. Participants can test their skills in a competitive, high-energy environment with cash prizes and sponsorships.
rules: Participants must register individually.
Match formats and game titles will be announced on the day of the event.
Fair play and sportsmanship are mandatory.

uiux-workshop.name: UI/UX Workshop
uiux-workshop.shortDescription: Design beautiful user interfaces and experiences.
uiux-workshop.description: The UI/UX Workshop provides an in-depth look into the principles of user interface and user experience design. Participants will learn about design trends, user research, wireframing, and prototyping.
rules: Participants should bring a sketchpad or digital device for design.
Basic knowledge of design software is recommended.
Certificates will be provided upon completion.

music-battle.name: Music Battle
music-battle.shortDescription: Showcase your musical talent and compete.
music-battle.description: The Music Battle is a competitive event for musicians and vocalists to perform live and compete for cash prizes and recognition. Participants can showcase their skills in a variety of genres.
rules: Performances should not exceed 5 minutes.
Participants must provide their own instruments.
Judging will be based on creativity, skill, and stage presence.

3d-printing-workshop.name: 3D Printing Workshop
3d-printing-workshop.shortDescription: Learn the basics of 3D printing technology.
3d-printing-workshop.description: The 3D Printing Workshop introduces participants to the world of 3D printing. It covers the fundamentals of 3D modeling, printing techniques, and post-processing, allowing attendees to create real objects from digital designs.
rules: Participants must complete a pre-workshop assignment.
Basic knowledge of 3D modeling is beneficial.
All designs must be original.

drone-racing.name: Drone Racing
drone-racing.shortDescription: Race high-speed drones through challenging circuits.
drone-racing.description: Drone Racing is a thrilling event where pilots race their drones through a complex circuit filled with obstacles and tight turns. Competitors must showcase precision control and quick reflexes to win.
rules: Participants must adhere to safety guidelines.
Drones must meet the specified technical requirements.
Any damage to the track will result in disqualification.
